name: gompo
text: I absolutely love Ray's open mouth in the last panel, he's just ramblin on in such a way as a fool does.

name: jdhenry105
text: Oh Beef.  Oh Beef.

name: havenless
text: Well that settles it, next time someone makes me crumby food, they're being forwarded to a psychiatrist.

name: spinynorman
text:
Usually you can tell if someone is depressed by the food they're making for themselves rather than what they give to other people. If a man is going to the trouble of making butternut squash curry with cilantro and pampadans then he clearly has energy, gumption, and confidence. If a man is making a Velveeta Sandwich with Heinz, he is in a Very Bad State Indeed.

Keep sharp things away from him and cook him something viscous and spicy. Keep him away from windows as well.

name: meowmix
text: He's doing even worse if he makes the sandwich with Hunt's.

name: spinynorman
text: Hunt's. That was it. Hunt's.

name: idsyen
text: A man who would use Hunt's catsup is truly staring into the void.

name: rawk5tar
text: And say nothing about he who prefers catsup over ketchup.

name: dusty
text: Truly it is the condiment of the cold and damned.

name: fattypneumonia
text: "This toe-MAY-toe will be Heinz Ketchup. And this toe-MAH-toe will be Hunt's Catsup."

name: shoinan
text: I made a butternut squash risotto for myself the other day. You've just made me feel good about myself, although apparently you did not need to.

name: rowboat
text: The only dishes I ever make for myself or for others are egg-heavy breakfast dishes, most of which will be smothered in sriracha. It does not matter what time of day or night it is. Deconstruct that shit.

name: fermatprime
text: I would, but I'm worried they'd send me to "caramel lattice prison," and I would "drop" the "demi-glaze soap."

name: melloclello
text: I remember reading this comment, a good year or so back. For some reason it was one of the few things I have read that have stuck with me. Tonight, I took it to heart, and cooked myself the best meal that I have had in a good three weeks. It was just a simple spaghetti bolognese, but believe you me, I cut no corners in its construction. The sense of control it gave me was as uplifting as one could hope for.

name: quinlaenar
text: I beg to differ. I am in a fairly decent state, I just cannot stand cooking or fancy foods in general. Give me a steak. Give me a velveeta sandwich. Give me something that I can cook in five minutes without having to stand there preparing for more than one minute.

name: quinlaenar
text: THAT'S RIGHT, I JUST DISAGREED WITH YOU TWO YEARS LATER, WHAT NOW?!

name: invidious
text:
Quote:
Well that settles it, next time someone makes me crumby food, they're being forwarded to a psychiatrist.

A shocking recent study reveals that 60% of all psychiatrists now work for Denny's.

name: robstrong
text: the varied perspective..... magnificent!

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text:
yes basically around seven.

i have never once gotten tired of how roast beef talks.

name: hellofyellin
text: A comment left by hellofyellin was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ezcmac, Overmedicated, clembot, teenheat)

name: jezebel
text: I guess, basically, that my family thinks I, basically, have brain damage due to the fact that I, basically, constantly use this adverb now.  Basically.

name: farqussus
text: you do

name: rowboat
text: Six commas in one sentence is almost never a good sign. Basically.

name: overmedicated
text: HHHHHHHHHHHHHHNNNNNNNNNNGGHHHHH

name: mockereo
text: I'd suggest Ex-lax immediately, then activia to help regulate your digestion. I mean they fucking named that bacteria Bifidus regularis , its gotta help you poop.

name: m3funkyb
text: ray doesn't know why fried foods don't stay crispy very long

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "actual noe on the monitor: ADD RAY'S NIPPLES"

name: lordhumungus
text: I've always wondered why Ray has nipples but not the other cats.

name: spectre
text:
tonight i'm serving my family crummy chimichangas

:-(

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Umm, I hope everything got worked out there, Spectre. Its cool. we love you. Just order from a nice mexican place!

name: nilehus
text:
guys, really

lamin the dude

stone cold

name: rowboat
text: You didn't taste his chimichangas. He's lucky he didn't get marked as spam.

name: gussiejives
text: Beef is the king of the nervous simultaneous back/face scratch.

name: dasilodavi
text: Expressing a need for help is a difficult thing.  Sometimes recognizing that cry is equally as difficult.  Ray wants to help his friend, and no doubt sees a great opportunity for help AND self-affirmation after feeling marginalized by Roast Beef's programming and nacho-making talents.  He is so intent on making this moment work he has not considered the possibility the abysmal chimichangas are intentional.  This is a shame, but we must have confidence that these two compatriots can "understand the lack of understanding."  Such is the way of true friendship.

name: naughtybyn8ture
text: love the alt text

name: wae
text: A very serious look at the hilarity of Beef's depression.

name: pez
text: i just got a serving job at a mexican restaurant and whenever i serve soggy chimis i stand beside the table long after ive served with a look of longing in my eyes

name: ham_shoes
text: That's gotta make the customers feel comfortable. Did you maybe get fired...?

name: landowmpg
text: He didn't reply.  Something horrible has happened.

name: jonnay
text: Dammit Ray!

name: nymphadoria
text: Sometimes the middle cat just needs help...ruined chimichangas aside.

name: laserblade
text: The " dammit " in italics makes this a 5.

name: mattylite
text: Imagine what Ray typed after "Dear Diary" that night...

name: thedice
text: I know I will.

name: babeeazz
text: the food comics are the best.
